alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:37PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... New River at Allisonia affecting Wythe and Pulaski Counties. For the New River...including Allisonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...New River at Allisonia. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, River begins to overflow the left bank and affect Clarks Ferry Road, Route 653. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight to a crest of 8.4 feet by tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1045 AM EST.
